pullRequest.title: iOS_alignment/retry failed uploads
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #830 and #1274
This PR is ready for review.
Risk
This PR makes minor API changes.
Testing Plan

 I have verified that I have not introduced new warnings in this PR (or explain why below)
 I have run the unit tests with this PR
 I have tested this PR against Core and verified behavior (if applicable, if not applicable, explain why below).
 I have tested Android, Java SE, and Java EE

Unit Tests
Created Unit test in FileManagerTest to simulate SdlFile/SdlArtwork failing to upload, then retrying upload base on FileManagerConfig:

testFileUploadRetry()
testArtworkUploadRetry()

Created Unit test in FileManagerTest to simulate a list of files failing and then retrying to upload them:

testListFilesUploadRetry()

Test for deleting a list of files:

testDeleteRemoteFilesWithNamesSuccess()
testDeleteRemoteFilesWithNamesFail()

Fixed some of the old unit test:
testFileUploadSuccess()
testMultipleFileUpload()
More test need to be fixed, going to open issue. I just fixed what was necessary for this feature.
Core Tests


Set FileManagerConfig values artworkRetryCount and fileRetryCount to at-least 2 or higher, (5) would be better and set each value different.(FileManagerConfig is set in sdlManager builder, see Summary below for example)


Commented out setting file data in FileManager createPutFile to simulate File Failing


Created SdlFile with a type of Audio_Wave, log every time file would retry to upload in baseFileManager uploadFile, in the onError of the listener where it recursively calls uploadFile.


Repeat with an Artwork filetype: BMP, JPEG, PNG.


Test uploading a list of files the same way except logging where it uploads in BaseFileManager sendMultipleFileOperations, in onFinished() where it recursively calls sendMultipleFileOperations.


With a list of files test setting one file to an instance of SdlArtwork and the other audio, have each file upload retry count be different and verify that you get both errors back on the developers side.


Summary
If a file fails to upload, the File will now retry to upload depending on what is set in FileManagerConfig setFileRetryCount() and setFielArtworkRetryCount(). Each value is set to 1 by default and initialized in sdlManager. If you want to set it higher, you can create an instance of FileManagerConfig and set it when you create the SdlManager Builder:
FileManagerConfig fileManagerConfig = new FileManagerConfig();
fileManagerConfig.setArtworkRetryCount(4);
fileManagerConfig.setFileRetryCount(5);
builder.setFileManagerConfig(fileManagerConfig);
sdlManager.start();
Enhancements

Added functionality to retry failed file uploads.

CLA

 I have signed the CLA

commit.message: Added FileManagerConfig
Add Retry logic for list of files
Added retry logic for single files
Added unit test
Added FileManagerConfig to Java SE

nodes.bodyText: Can we add javadoc to all methods in this class?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@
+package com.smartdevicelink.managers.file;

nodes.bodyText: If the JavaSE and the Android copies for this file are identical, would it be possible to just add one copy to the base folder so both projects can reuse that file?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@
+package com.smartdevicelink.managers.file;

nodes.bodyText: Can we declare this variable outside the // Managers block?  it could be just below lockScreenConfig. same applies to the SdlManager for javaSE
We should mention what the default configs are at least in the FileManagerConfig class. This applies to JavaSE as well
Can we add one space after the "," and before and FileManagerConfig? Also, it is always better to add javadoc to all new methods. This also applies to the javaSE copy
This comment is not very clear

I see that this method and the other one that takes SdlFile are very similar in the logic. Would it be possible to make a new one that works for both situations? something like:
private boolean shouldReuploadFile(String fileName, FileType fileType)
There is extra space here
Remember to clean personal comments
Can we rename customErrors to errorsForRequestsThatCannotBeResent to make it clear what map stores? Also there is an extra space after customErrors
there are some formatting issues in this method. Can we use the Android Studio reformatter tool to reformat this method?
Can we rename this to requestsToResend
Can we remove the extra spaces here?

commit.message: Changed Location of FileManagerConfig
Deleting FileMangerConfig form JavaSE
Formatting FileManager in android and JavaSE
Formatting and moving location of declaring FileManagerConfig
Modified UploadFiles and sendMultipleFileOperations to use new method shouldReuploadFile, getting rid of two methods. Reorganized logic in sendMultipleFileOperations to be more efficient
Added javaDocs to FileManagerConfig
Add javadocs and remove extra space
removed space
Fixed ClassCast Exception for deleteFiles
Added unit test for deleting files, added comments/fixed formatting
Modified broken test for file upload success.

nodes.bodyText: There should be a description for what each param means in the javadoc. This comment applies to all newly added  javadoc comments in this PR.
Can we use HashMap instead of HashTable? I believe it is more efficient.
There is no space after , and two spaces before errors
The description for the params in javadoc is not very clear. They should define what each param means.
Android studio is showing a warning here about a potential NPE. If the value for failedFileUploadsIndex.get(fileName) is null then it cannot be compared to 0 for example.
There should be one space after ,
the new param (errors) should be described in the javadoc

Formatting
